description: The intent of this segment is to describe the actual donation procedure.

1.name: Donation Identification Number - DIN
1.description: 4.17.1.2 Definition: This field contains a unique identifier, Donation Identification Number (DIN), for the specific donation and is therefore mandatory except when using an eligibility message type in which only DON-9, DON-10, and DON-11 are populated.

10.name: Donor Eligibility Procedure Type
10.description: The procedure(s) for which the donor is eligible. Refer to HL7-Defined Table 0933 – Intended Procedure Type in Chapter 2C, Code Tables, for valid entries.

11.name: Donor Eligibility Date
11.description: The date and time on which the donor is eligible to donate

12.name: Process Interruption
12.description: Was the donation process interrupted after it began? Refer to HL7-Defined Table 0923 – Process Interruption in Chapter 2C, Code Tables, for valid entries

13.name: Process Interruption Reason
13.description: Reason that the donation process was interrupted. Refer to HL7-Defined Table 0935 – Process Interruption Reason in Chapter 2C, Code Tables, for valid entries

14.name: Phlebotomy Issue
14.description: Indicates whether there is a problem or issue with the phlebotomy itself. This may be due to an incorrect needle procedure, needle defect, tube blockage, problem with the apheresis machine, or improper action by the phlebotomist. Refer to HL7-Defined Table 0925 – Phlebotomy Issue in Chapter 2C, Code Tables, for valid entries.

15.name: Intended Recipient Blood Relative
15.description: If this donation has an intended recipient (directed, dedicated, designated), is the intended recipient a blood relative of the donor? Yes or No. Refer to HL7 Table 0136 -Yes/No Indicator as defined in Chapter 2C, Code Tables
15.data_type: ID - Coded Value For Hl7 Defined Tables

16.name: Intended Recipient Name
16.description: If this is donation has an intended recipient (autologous, directed, dedicated, designated), the intended recipient’s name

17.name: Intended Recipient DOB
17.description: If this donation has an intended recipient (autologous, directed, dedicated, designated), the intended recipient’s date of birth

18.name: Intended Recipient Facility
18.description: If this donation has an intended recipient (autologous, directed, dedicated, designated), the facility where the intended recipient is expected to receive the transfusion.
18.data_type: XON - Extended Composite Name And Identification Number For Organizations

19.name: Intended Recipient Procedure Date
19.description: If this donation has an intended recipient (autologous, directed, dedicated, designated), the date the intended recipient is expected to receive the transfusion.

2.name: Donation Type
2.description: The type of donation. This element is mandatory except when using an eligibility message type in which only DON-9, DON-10, and DON-11 are populated. The values for this field are defined in Table RT008 - Type of Donation or Collection in 6th Position of Product Code in the ISBT 128 Standard Technical Specification, which is maintained by ICCBBA. Link: http://iccbba.org/technicalspecification.pdf. Table 5 Data Structure 002.

20.name: Intended Recipient Ordering Provider
20.description: If this is donation has an intended recipient (autologous, directed, dedicated, designated), the provider who ordered the directed donation for the intended recipient.

21.name: Phlebotomy Status
21.description: Whether the phlebotomy was successful, not drawn, or unsuccessful, and if unsuccessful, the extent to which it was unsuccessful. Refer to HL7-Defined Table 0926 – Phlebotomy Status in Chapter 2C, Code Tables, for valid entries

22.name: Arm Stick
22.description: The arm(s) stuck for the donation. Refer to HL7-Defined Table 0927 – Arm Stick in Chapter 2C, Code Tables, for valid entries

23.name: Bleed Start Phlebotomist
23.description: The Phlebotomist who starts the blood flow into the container

24.name: Bleed End Phlebotomist
24.description: The Phlebotomist who ends the blood flow into the container

25.name: Aphaeresis Type Machine
25.description: The type of aphaeresis machine, if used, for the donation. It will be the specific product name of the machine (e.g. Trima, Amicus, Alyx, Symal, etc.).

26.name: Aphaeresis Machine Serial Number
26.description: The serial number of the aphaeresis machine, if used, for the donation.

27.name: Donor Reaction
27.description: Did the donor have any adverse reaction during the donation procedure? Yes or No. Refer to HL7 Table 0136 -Yes/No Indicator as defined in Chapter 2C, Code Tables. If this element is valued "Y"es, there should be OBX segments following the Donation segment which details the adverse reactions.
27.data_type: ID - Coded Value For Hl7 Defined Tables

28.name: Final Review Staff ID
28.description: The Staff member conducting the final review and reconciliation of all documentation created during the collection process

29.name: Final Review Date/Time
29.description: The date and time a final review of all documentation and labeling of the blood material is completed.

3.name: Phlebotomy Start Date/Time
3.description: The start date and time of the phlebotomy.

30.name: Number of Tubes Collected
30.description: The number of samples collected during the donation which will be used for subsequent testing

31.name: Donation Sample Identifier
31.description: The sample identifier for the sample collected during a donation for the purpose of testing. This is a field for sample or specimen identifiers

32.name: Donation Accept Staff
32.description: The staff member who reviewed all the intake materials, assessments and determined the donor can undergo a donation procedure at this time
32.data_type: XCN - Extended Composite Id Number And Name For Persons

33.name: Donation Material Review Staff
33.description: The staff member who performs review on all documentation subsequent to donation procedure
33.data_type: XCN - Extended Composite Id Number And Name For Persons

4.name: Phlebotomy End Date/Time
4.description: The end date and time of the phlebotomy

5.name: Donation Duration
5.description: The duration of the phlebotomy or the length of time that elapsed between the phlebotomy start date and time and the phlebotomy end date and time.

6.name: Donation Duration Units
6.description: The duration units. The duration units and duration are restricted to minutes and seconds. Concepts are pulled from the UCUM code system (www.unitsofmeasure.org). Refer to HL7-Defined Table 0932 – Donation Duration Units in Chapter 2C, Code Tables, for valid entries

7.name: Intended Procedure Type
7.description: The procedure(s) intended to be performed on the donor. Refer to HL7-Defined Table 0933 – Intended Procedure Type in Chapter 2C, Code Tables, for valid entries

8.name: Actual Procedure Type
8.description: The actual procedure(s) performed on the donor. Refer to HL7-Defined Table 0933 – Intended Procedure Type in Chapter 2C, Code Tables, for valid entries

9.name: Donor Eligibility Flag
9.description: Is the Donor eligible for donation? Yes or No. Refer to HL7 Table 0136 -Yes/No Indicator as defined in Chapter 2C, Code Tables.
9.data_type: ID - Coded Value For Hl7 Defined Tables
